data.title: Jump Crypto Converts Significant SOL Holdings to Bitcoin
data.description: According to BlockBeats On-chain Detection, Jump Crypto has been observed exchanging a substantial amount of SOL for Bitcoin. In the last 15 minutes, Jump Crypto transferred 1.1 million SOL, valued at approximately $205 million, to Galaxy Digital. In return, they received 2,455 BTC, worth around $265 million.

data.title: Analysis: The Federal Reserve may ease monetary policy amid rising inflation.
data.description: Investment firm Aureus Asset Management's analysis points out that the Federal Reserve may ease monetary policy amid escalating inflation, with the market expecting a rate cut by the Fed at least until December. However, the risk of rising inflation remains significant. Despite all tariff negotiations, prices remain high, and there has been a growing focus on fixed income, finding its volatility can actually be reduced, rather than solely investing in stocks as in the past. (Jinshi)

data.title: A whale with a 100% win rate has opened another long position in Bitcoin, currently valued at approximately $9.8 million.
data.description: A whale with a 100% win rate has opened another long position in Bitcoin with 13x leverage, currently valued at approximately $9.8 million, with an opening price of $111,099.2. In addition, this whale currently holds a long position in SOL with 10x leverage, valued at approximately $110 million, with a floating loss of $1.25 million.

data.title: MilkyWay: Massdrop Phase 3 is now open for applications.
data.description: Celestia's liquidity staking protocol, MilkyWay, announced on the X platform that the third phase of the Massdrop airdrop is now open for applications. data.title: Bank of America, Goldman Sachs, and JPMorgan Chase release previews of the Federal Reserve meetings.
data.description: Bank of America, Goldman Sachs, and JPMorgan Chase released their previews of the Federal Reserve meeting, including: 1. Bank of America's view on Powell and the Fed meeting: Due to limited official data and the mismatch between labor market and consumer data, Powell is unlikely to provide further economic guidance after this meeting. The statement may indicate a "robust" rebound in economic activity. Possible objections: hawkish objections from Milan (suggesting a 50 basis point rate cut) or Goolsby/Schmid. Quantitative tightening will end immediately. Powell's press conference may focus on the discrepancy between consumer and labor market data, and market reaction will depend on his interpretation of the strong consumer performance. Expected future rate cuts: October, June, September, and December 2026. 2. Goldman Sachs' comment on the Federal Open Market Committee: The market's focus may be on how close the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) is to its own policy, with quantitative tightening (QT) being crucial. This meeting is very likely to end quantitative tightening. Future rate cut plan: 25 basis point cuts each in October and December, followed by two more cuts in 2026, with a target interest rate range of 3% to 3.25%. 3. JPMorgan Chase on the Federal Open Market Committee: The market widely expects a rate cut, and even hawkish Fed officials have not disputed market expectations. The statement is expected to remain largely unchanged—economic activity remains robust, but job growth is slowing and inflation remains high. Milan may oppose a 50 basis point rate cut; quantitative tightening will end immediately. Powell will define the easing policy as risk management and will not provide guidance on the policy direction in December. Future rate cut plan: 25 basis point cuts each in October, December, and January.

data.title: UK Opens Crypto ETN Market to Retail Investors Amid Intense Fee Competition
data.description:
According to Cointelegraph, the United Kingdom has recently allowed retail investors access to crypto exchange-traded notes (ETNs), a market previously restricted to professional traders. This move has ignited fierce competition among issuers, with several Bitcoin ETN providers significantly reducing their fees to attract investors. The Financial Times reports that some issuers have lowered fees to as little as 0.05%, while others continue to charge up to 2.5% annually. This competitive landscape emerged following the Financial Conduct Authority's (FCA) decision to lift its 2021 ban on retail access to crypto-linked funds, effective from October 8.

The policy change has been welcomed by industry figures such as Ian Taylor, board adviser at CryptoUK, who expressed satisfaction with the reversal and noted the progress made towards a more balanced approach to consumer risk. Among the newly accessible ETNs are 21Shares’ Core Bitcoin and Ethereum Core Staking ETPs, which have reduced their fees to 0.1%, Fidelity’s Physical Bitcoin ETP at 0.25%, and CoinShares’ Physical Staked Ethereum ETP, which currently has no management fee.

This regulatory shift is part of a broader initiative to bolster the United Kingdom's position in global crypto adoption, which has been lagging. A significant point of contention has been the treatment of stablecoins, with industry participants opposing the Bank of England’s (BoE) proposals for stringent corporate holding limits. Bloomberg reports that the BoE is reconsidering its stance due to concerns that the United States is advancing with the GENIUS Act, designed to establish clearer rules for stablecoin issuers.

BoE Governor Andrew Bailey has recently softened his approach, moving away from previous warnings about the potential risks of private stablecoins to financial stability. He now acknowledges the innovative potential of the technology and its increasing significance in the financial system. This shift in regulatory attitude reflects a growing recognition of the need to adapt to the evolving digital asset landscape, ensuring the UK remains competitive in the global market.

data.title: StableFlow Expands Support to Aptos for Stablecoin Transfers
data.description: According to Foresight News, StableFlow, a cross-chain service for stablecoins, has announced its support for Aptos, enabling users to transfer stablecoins of any amount. The platform already supports networks such as EVM, Solana, and NEAR Protocol.

data.title: JPMorgan Tokenizes Private Equity Fund on Kinexys Blockchain — Here Is How It’s Reshaping Institutional Finance
data.description:
"JPMorgan has taken a significant step in the field of finance by tokenizing a private equity fund on the Kinexys blockchain, a move that is poised to fundamentally transform the landscape of institutional finance. This innovative approach utilizes blockchain technology to enhance transparency, efficiency, and accessibility in private equity investments, allowing institutional investors to engage more easily with previously illiquid assets. By leveraging the advantages of tokenization, JPMorgan is not only streamlining the investment process but also setting a precedent for how traditional finance can adapt and evolve in the digital age. Here, we delve into the key components of this groundbreaking initiative and explore its potential implications for the future of institutional investing."
source: https://blocknews.com/jpmorgan-tokenizes-private-equity-fund-on-kinexys-blockchain-here-is-how-its-reshaping-institutional-finance/

data.title: Michael Saylor: Bitcoin could reach $150,000 by the end of the year, with a target of $1 million in the next 4 to 8 years.
data.description: In an interview with CNBC, Strategy founder Michael Saylor gave his latest Bitcoin price prediction: $150,000 by the end of the year, with a target of $1 million over the next 4 to 8 years. (Bitcoin Magazine)

data.title: Nordea Bank allows clients to trade synthetic ETPs pegged to Bitcoin.
data.description: Nordea Bank has announced it will offer customers an exchange-traded product (ETP) pegged to Bitcoin. Previously cautious about cryptocurrencies, Nordea stated that with the maturing regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies in Europe and the growing demand for virtual currencies and cryptocurrencies in the Nordic region, it has decided to allow customers to trade cryptocurrency-related products on its platform. Nordea will allow customers to trade a cryptocurrency-related product developed by an external company, CoinShares, on its platform. This new product will launch on the Nordea Bank platform in December 2025. (Bloomberg)

data.title: Cardano Confirms Death Cross as Major Sell-off Hits Market
data.description:
Cardano has completed a death cross as the sell-off worsened in a volatile Thursday session that saw nearly $1. 13 billion in leveraged futures liquidations.
source: https://u.today/cardano-confirms-death-cross-as-major-sell-off-hits-market

data.title: CBDC with Stablecoin Mechanics: Indonesia’s Digital Rupiah to Be Backed by Government Bonds
data.description:
Bank Indonesia launches plans for a digital rupiah backed by government bonds, reflecting ongoing efforts to integrate blockchain into monetary operations.
source: https://cryptonews.com/news/cbdc-with-stablecoin-mechanics-indonesias-digital-rupiah-to-be-backed-by-government-bonds/
